metadata.title: CVE-2021-33571 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: In Django 2.2 before 2.2.24, 3.x before 3.1.12, and 3.2 before 3.2.4, URLValidator, validate_ipv4_address, and validate_ipv46_address do not prohibit leading zero characters in octal literals. This may allow a bypass of access control that is based on IP addresses. (validate_ipv4_address and validate_ipv46_address are unaffected with Python 3.9.5+..) .

notes.note: mdeslaur> Python earlier than 3.8.0 is not vulnerable to CVE-2021-29921, so django in bionic and earlier do not require fixes

criterions.comment: python-django package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.2.20-1ubuntu0.2').
